title: manual: fix link to using `delta` on Windows
body: Self-explanatory.

title: Misc tab refactoring
body:
Just internal refactoring, except for the new silent limit of 64 for `--tabs` which might affect very eccentric user configs. However I think arbitrary lengths can be enabled again once I add the option to allow user configurable tab replacement chars.

And related, in my opinion the default tab size should be changed from 4 to **8**, as that is what most editors default to (not to be confused with the default indent width of e.g. 4 in Rust). What do you think @wescande @nickelc @phillipwood?

title: Fix submodule diff parsing
body: Added support for an optional -dirty hash suffix which is present in `git diff` output when files were changed in a submodule.

title: Introduce `grep-output-type` option: ripgrep or classic
body: WIP Fixes #1289 TODO: - [x] Make `navigate` work correctly on grep output

title: Replace deprecated `error_chain` crate with `anyhow`
body:
The `error_chain` crate is now deprecated for a long time and [`anyhow`](https://crates.io/crates/anyhow) has proven to be a popular replacement for applications.

This also improves the current error messages for panics.

```
PAGER='"less' git show
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: \
Error(Msg("Could not parse pager command."), State { next_error: Some(ParseError), \
backtrace: InternalBacktrace })', src/main.rs:136:88
```

```
PAGER='"less' git show
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Could not parse pager command.

Caused by:
    missing closing quote', src/main.rs:125:88
```

title: Improve manual build job
body:
- Only trigger the build if the book has changed.
- Split the job into `build` and `deploy` with specific permissions.
- Don't build documentation for dependencies.
- Deploy to GitHub Pages directly without going through the `gh-pages` branch.

The third point fixes the current problem building the docs of the `rustix` crate with Rust 1.69.

title: Clarify how to use delta with `tmux`
body: I recently spent a lot of time trying to make delta work with tmux and I was very confused since my neovim colors worked properly but not delta. In the end I noticed that I had to explicitly enable true color as the default was `auto`. I thought this information might be useful to other people too

title: Fix some typos
body: Corrects some typos.

title: Downgrade and pin the `bytelines` crate
body:
The versions 2.3+ added support for Tokio's `AsyncBufRead` trait and futures' `Stream` trait without making the new dependencies optional.

By downgrading `bytelines`, the compilation time can be reduced.

```
$ cargo up -p bytelines --precise 2.2.2
    Updating bytelines v2.4.0 -> v2.2.2
    Removing bytes v1.4.0
    Removing futures v0.3.26
    Removing futures-channel v0.3.26
    Removing futures-core v0.3.26
    Removing futures-executor v0.3.26
    Removing futures-io v0.3.26
    Removing futures-macro v0.3.26
    Removing futures-sink v0.3.26
    Removing futures-task v0.3.26
    Removing futures-util v0.3.26
    Removing pin-project-lite v0.2.9
    Removing pin-utils v0.1.0
    Removing slab v0.4.8
    Removing tokio v1.26.0
```

There is a open PR that would fix the issue.
- https://github.com/whitfin/bytelines/pull/7

title: add: installation instructions for conda/mamba
body:
Hey,

Just a small addition: I wanted to mention that I added git-delta to the [conda-forge repository](https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/git-delta).
It's built for all major platforms and architectures there. 

While delta is probably more of a system package than an "environment-dependent" package, having a conda-installation helps; for example for enterprise environments.

Just wanted to reflect that in the installation instructions!

title: Add link to similar project walles/riff
body: Add link to similar project <http://github.com/walles/riff>.

title: Update `bitflags` to 2.2
body: The `Clone`, `Copy`, `Debug` and `PartialEq` traits are no longer derived automatically by the macro.

title: Remove manual line-wrapping
body: Fixes #1316

title: Remove unneeded `extern crate` statements
body: With edition 2018, `extern crate` is no longer needed in most circumstances.

title: Merge the different `GitConfig` constructors for a config file
body: The `try_create_from_path` function and the `from_path` function for tests can be merged into a single function.

title: Derive the default for enums with `#[derive(Default)]`/`#[default]`
body: This feature was stabilized with 1.62 and clippy now complains about it.

title: Set language specifiers for code blocks and fix links in manual
body:
Plain links need to be enclosed in `<>` to linkify them.

The language specifiers fixes the rustdoc errors for `mdbook test`.

title: Rename `git_config_entry` module to `remote`
body: The `GitConfigEntry` enum has been removed from the module and now only contains the `GitRemoteRepo` type.

title: Add methods for getting `GitConfig` as reference
body: This improves the readability.

title: Add discord-dark theme
body: This theme formats diffs for posting to Discord, using its limited, custom ANSI colour set. Labels are used and plus and minus signs are kept since Discord mobile lacks ANSI highlighting.

title: Add Winget Releaser workflow
body:
[This action](https://github.com/vedantmgoyal2009/winget-releaser) automatically generates manifests for Winget Community Repository ([microsoft/winget-pkgs](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs)) and submits them.

Delta has recently been added to Winget (https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs/pull/94791), and this workflow will be used to keep it up to date.

**Before merging this:**
1. Add a **classic** PAT with `public_repo` scope as a repository secret named `WINGET_TOKEN`.

![example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56180050/180631504-f19d12cc-19ce-4991-a753-d4f7ff0adbca.png)

2. Fork https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs under @dandavison. The action will use that fork for making a branch and creating a PR with the upstream [winget-pkgs](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs) repository on every release.
3. Install [Pull](https://github.com/apps/pull) on the winget-pkgs fork to ensure that it is constantly updated.

You can test out the action inputs in this [playground](https://bittu.eu.org/docs/wr-playground).

If you want to see an example of a PR created using this action, see [microsoft/winget-pkgs/pulls (Pull request has been created with WinGet Releaser)](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs/pulls?q=is%3Apr+sort%3Aupdated-desc+Pull+request+has+been+created+with+WinGet+Releaser).

title: Get git's minus/plus style from config instead of copying it around
body: After removing the `GitConfigEntry::GitRemote` variant, the enum can be removed and the git config can be accessed directly.

title: Return the `GitRemoteRepo` type directly
body: The type is unnecessarily wrapped and it's the only use for `GitConfigEntry::GitRemote` enum variant.

title: Encapsulate `git2` types
body: The PR makes the `git2` types private and moves related methods to the `GitConfig` type.

title: Update dependencies & switch back to the `dirs` crate
body:
The `dirs`/`dirs-sys` repositories are unarchived and the crates are
maintained again, while `dirs-next` crates aren't.

The crate is also used by the `xdg` crate.

title: Added config option.
body:
This PR adds two new options:

1. `--config <PATH>`: Can be used to load a config file different from `./.gitconfig`. The loaded file MUST use the same format.
2. `--features-first`: (bool) When enabled, this options gives features priority towards the default delta section. For instance, if we have the following `.gitconfig` file:

    ```
    [delta]
    pager = DEFAULT
   
    [delta "feature"]
    pager = FEATURE
    ```

    With the current delta (or, if this PR lands, by default) the final resolved value for the pager, even if the feature `feature` is enabled) would be `DEFAULT`. With the new option, the final resolved values becomes `FEATURE`.

Fixes #1301.

title: Update `git2` to 0.16.1
body: `git2::ConfigEntries` no longer implements `Iterator` since `git2` 0.15.

title: Update `clap` to 4.1
body:
This PR is a continuation of #1253 

Thanks to @tjquillan

title: Fix the`--show-themes` command
body: The command failed because the two empty arguments for the internal `Opt` parsing actually meant "<binary> <minus_file>" and since `minus_file` is [now parsed with `PathBufValueParser`](https://github.com/dandavison/delta/commit/5cef3872999f1084cb13013b002a6421c4aa3f15) and the value parser rejects empty values.

title: Fix warning from bat for an unknown syntax theme
Replace unmaintained/outdated GitHub Actions
body: The unmaintained `action-rs/*` actions are replaced with `dtolnay/rust-toolchain`, `taiki-e/install-action` and plain cargo commands.

title: Reduce allocations during `--show-colors`
body: Using `BTreeMap` makes the additional allocation for sorting unnecessary.

title: Fix clippy warnings
body: The PR fixes the current clippy warnings + some warnings from the tests.

title: Add `gruvmax-fang` theme
body:
I spent more time than I intended customizing my own diff output and it turned out really nice so I figured I might as well upstream it. Inspired by [gruvbox](https://github.com/morhetz/gruvbox), `bat`'s default diff, and the existing `delta` themes.

### Split diff

![Git show with split diff](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7884003/215024061-3d532ebf-4072-4310-8d90-6351e2b2775a.png)

### Unified diff

![Unified diff](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7884003/215024164-85b92c17-ec85-4776-8888-fbd5e7f9cc19.png)

### Git blame

![Git blame 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7884003/215026112-dd7c595c-c916-485a-913f-9eb02601fee6.png)

### Merge conflicts

![Merge conflicts](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7884003/215024297-8241728c-9650-463b-8e8d-d4681138f8f7.png)

title: Spelling
body:
This PR corrects misspellings identified by the [check-spelling action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/check-spelling).

The misspellings have been reported at https://github.com/jsoref/delta/commit/4cd0bb80f540a3f0b7f8521bdefac142c25c6e29#commitcomment-92671729

The action reports that the changes in this PR would make it happy: https://github.com/jsoref/delta/commit/910296e330542cf0e048feee706f88c270b91def

Note: this PR does not include the action. If you're interested in running a spell check on every PR and push, that can be offered separately.

title: Address deprecated clap features
body:
This PR aims to address some deprecation in `clap` in order to make moving to `clap` 4 easier. Depreciations were found by running `cargo check --features clap/deprecated`.

Deprecations:
* [`clap::CommandFactory::command` is now preferred over `clap::IntoApp::into_app`](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#deprecations)
* [For `#[clap(parse(from_os_str)]` for `PathBuf`, replace it with `#[clap(value_parser)]`](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#320---2022-06-13)
* [`ArgMatches::occurrences_of` with `ArgMatches::value_source` or `ArgAction::Count`](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#320---2022-06-13)
* `clap::Arg::<'help>::get_name`: Replaced with `Arg::get_id`

title: Explicitly request xz compression
body: Fixes #1248

title: Highlighting improvements
body:
While using delta I have noticed a few cases where the highlighting
was not quite as good as it could have been. This PR attempts to
address that. The most significant change is that where possible
insertions and deletions are grouped together to minimize the number of
groups of changes within a line. For example the change
    
    -printf "%s\n" s y y ...
    +test_write_lines s y n ...

is now highlighted as

    -[printf "%s\n"] s y n ...
    +[test_write_lines] s y y ...

rather than

    -[printf "%]s[\n"] [s ]y y ...
    +[test_write_lines ]s y y ...

There are several other changes:
 - Unchanged tokens are less likely to be highlighted when the length of
the line is unchanged.
 - Where possible deletions will now precede insertions.
 - An unchanged space at the end of a line will not be highlighted as
changed when it is preceded by a changed word.

I was unsure whether to squash the last two commits together. The
diffstat of the combined patch is quite a bit smaller than the two
separate patches but I think it is clearer to show the changes
separately.

title: ci: release apple arm binary
body:
Requested [here](https://github.com/dandavison/delta/issues/484#issuecomment-1312790539)

There are no VMs for GitHub actions that support Mac ARM. See https://github.com/actions/runner-images/issues/2187.
So we cannot run tests for MAC ARM. However, we can run `cargo build`, which is what's required to build the binary.

- [x] to be merged after #1238

title: ci: improve formatting
body:
It looks better like this. What do you think?
It's the same syntax used [here](https://github.com/rust-github/rust-gh-example/blob/main/.github/workflows/cd.yml).

EDIT:
- [x] apply it also in ci.yaml

title: Remove Git 2.37 workaround from install docs
body:
The bug was fixed in Git 2.38, as noted on original issue: https://github.com/dandavison/delta/issues/1114#issuecomment-1265920597

I guess we can remove this from the docs now, so new users don’t switch to the old interactive `add`.

I thought of adding a section “If you’re using Git 2.37...” but that seemed too specific. If anyone encounters the error, hopefully they’ll search for it and see they need to upgrade Git.

title: Handle quoted filenames in diff header
body: Otherwise the file extension would return 'rs"' which does not match any language.

title: Remove Provides in Debian package
body:
Remove Provides in Debian package as this is incorrect usage of this flag.

To provide two versions of packages `Conflicts` as used is sufficient.

See Debian Policy Manual (v4.6.1.1) section 7.5

When at it Remove trailing dot in Description header to comply with section 5.6.13

Fixes: https://github.com/dandavison/delta/issues/1210

title: measure_text_width() without constructing a temporary string
body: The improvement probably can't be measured, but still feels right :)

body:
Hi there
As I was looking through the file and I decided to make it a bit cleaner.

No actual changes are supposed to be done.
Except her it was unsound that we are not doing anything with old element but I decided to make it explicit `None`. 

https://github.com/zhiburt/delta/blob/22ff23d588a9b483b9457f8df6b414f59122b7e1/src/ansi/iterator.rs#L134

title: Switch bat to library mode
body: This disables bat dependencies that are only required for the `bat` binary, e.g. clap v2. Should cut down a bit on the build time.

title: Fixed broken link to README
body: The "Configuration" chapter has been removed in 6f0bcbd504b397479eab97a5026ef96f3ad10eb3, so I replace the link.

title: Change Rust toolchain in 'Deploy Manual' CI task
Added auto completions for fish shell
body:
I added auto completions for the fish shell.

On the next release, it is probably a good idea to take a note for packagers that this file should be delivered as `/usr/share/fish/vendor_completions.d/delta.fish`.

title: Support configurable timestamps in git blame output (#1157)
body:
New CLI/config option is introduced: blame-timestamp-output-format.

Fixes #1157.

title: Fix typos
body:
Found via following command:

    codespell -L crate,nin,numer,struc,ded,fo

title: try fix bad alignment in unicode (#1144)
body: Add spaces in `truncate_str` doesn't satisify the function description. So I change the function `pad_panel_line_to_width` (maybe not right)

title: Fix warning highlight for trailing whitespace
body:
Fix #137
and added some corresponding test

`git diff` without pager on the left, current delta on the middle, proposed version on the right
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20841006/162073430-f6124d8e-eaf8-4f73-8cff-99b9eb9cbbcf.png)


---


Because the whitespace error style is applied on a complete section I needed to split the section in smaller section when there was space at the end. Thus I needed to edit some of `test_infer_edits`. 

I suppose this change does not contains all the test case for handling the trailing whitespace perfectly.
Maybe this should also be done in :
* align::Operation::Substitution
* align::Operation::Insertion

title: Add terminal width fallback via stty if on windows/MSYS2
